subject: Re: How to use JUnit for multi-threaded code?
msgSnippet: Pat, A tip: Test your multi-threaded code on a computer with more than one processor. Some problems with multi-threading don t show up on a single cpu
messageBody:
Pat,

A tip:
Test your multi-threaded code on a computer with more than one
processor. Some problems with multi-threading don't show up on a
single cpu computer.

Regards, Jan

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Pat Farrell <pfarrell@...> wrote:
>
> Java has been multi-threaded from the start, and Java 5 has native
API
> support for things like Barriers that used to be rolled by a
toolsmith
> reading the O'Reilly "Java Threads" book.
>
> It is not clear to me how to use JUnit to test multi-thread
applications.
>
> Is it possible?
> Any hints and tips?
>
> --
> Pat Farrell
> http://www.pfarrell.com/
>
